page.title: 12Architecture in Sth.Benfleet
page.content: The oldest building is St.Mary's Church. Examples of medieval half_timbered buildings can be found near the church:The Hoy and Helmet and the Anchor date back to the early 16th century and display original oak beams.The Half_Crown is a 19th century brick building on a possible medieval foundation.Before a lorry demolished part of it in 1972 it was called the Crown.Some half_timbered cottages and houses with weather_boarding cluster around the church.An upsurge in building around the turn of the century has left some remnants of a few grand Victorian houses in Vicarage Hill, Benfleet Road and Thundersley Pk Road.In some cases new facades hide the original construction.The shopping arcades along the High Road are mostly converted Victorian terrace houses whose origin can still be discerned.
